body:
spack view yields an error, after which view creation seems to be halted, and hence view is unusable. Experienced same error with spack view installation of python, and other packages.

### Expected Result
view is created with all dependencies

### Actual Result
spack view installation seem to halt after error, hence some dependencies even the actual package executables might be missing from the installation (which occured in the case of "python")

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ user@host03 ~ $ spack view symlink ~/Downloads/r-3.5.0 r /romqldl
==> Error: [/home/user/Downloads/r-3.5.0] Cannot link package gdbm, file already exists: /home/user/Downloads/r-3.5.0/share/info/dir
...
```

### Information on your system

centos6, though it also happened on centos7.
title: spack view: Error: Cannot link package gdbm, file already exists: /home/someuser/Downloads/r-3.5.0/share/info/dir
